subject: Nutrition
title: Iron Deficiency in Athletes
description: A quick, practical guide to Iron Deficiency in Athletes.

hook.text: Up to 35% of female athletes are iron deficient. It's the most common nutritional problem in sport.

buildup.text: Iron carries oxygen in red blood cells. Low iron means less oxygen reaches your working muscles.

discovery.text: Runners lose iron through foot-strike impact and sweat, causing higher depletion than sedentary people.

twist.text: Many athletes train at reduced capacity for months before iron deficiency is finally diagnosed.

climax.text: Regular blood testing and iron-rich foods prevent this silent thief from stealing performance.

punchline.text: Low iron steals performance before you notice it's gone.
